intro: Betonica rigida, commonly known as rigid betony, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture and produces clusters of blue or violet flowers. Betonica rigida is often found in moist meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks. It is valued in traditional herbal medicine for its purported calming and digestive properties.
